org.desc: Den Arnamagnæanske Samling er en enhed under Institut for Nordiske Studier og Sprogvidenskab. Samlingen blev i 1956 oprettet som et institut under det Humanistiske Fakultet, med det formål at videreføre den videnskabelige udnyttelse af Den Arnamagnæanske Håndskriftsamling, som den islandske filolog og historiker, Arne Magnusson, testamenterede til Københavns Universitet ved sin død i 1730.

The Arnamagnæan Institute is a teaching and research institute within the Faculty of Humanities at the University of Copenhagen whose function is to further the study of the manuscripts in the Arnamagnæan collection, in keeping with the terms of the Arnamagnæan Foundation, established in 1760. The Institute is a unit under the Department of Nordic Studies and Linguistics.

Den Arnamagnæanske Kommission blev nedsat i 1772 som bestyrelse for Den Arnamagnæanske Stiftelse, den samling af håndskrifter og trykte bøger som Árni Magnússon sammen med sin private formue testamenterede til Københavns Universitet ved sin død i 1730.

The Arnamagnaean Commission was set up in 1772 as a governing body for the Arnamagnaean Foundation, the collection of manuscripts and printed books that Árni Magnússon bequeathed, along with his private estate, to the University of Copenhagen on his death in 1730.
Bibliothèque nationale de France is the national library of France, located in Paris. It is the national repository of all that is published in France and also holds extensive historical collections.
Bibliothèque Sainte-Geneviève is a public and university library in Paris, which inherited the collection of the Abbey of St Genevieve. The library contains around 2 million documents.

Det Danske Sprog- og Litteraturselskab udgiver og dokumenterer dansk sprog og litteratur fra de ældste tider til i dag - i bogform og på nettet. Selskabet beskæftiger ca. 30 videnskabelige medarbejdere og en væsentligt større kreds af medlemmer, som fører tilsyn med udgivelserne og udgør selskabets øverste myndighed. Selskabet blev stiftet i 1911
Selskabet blev stiftet i 1742

Gammeldansk Ordbog er en ordbog over middelalderens danske sprog. Den dækker perioden fra ca. 1100 til 1515. Gammeldansk Ordbog indgår i samarbejde med andre forskningsprojekter. Dele af seddelsamlingen kan stilles til rådighed for forskere, der arbejder i ordbogens lokaler, og redaktørerne besvarer spørgsmål, der kan belyses af ordbogens samlinger.

The Manor House of Moesgård in the woods south of Århus is the home of Moesgård Museum with archaeological and ethnographic collections. The permanent exhibition presents many unique archaeological finds from prehistoric Denmark. Two finds from the Iron Age - the Grauballe Man, the only completely preserved bog body, and the impressive sacrifices of weapons from Illerup Ådal - are the absolute highlights. Changing special exhibitions deal with archaeological and ethnographic topics. To the north of the exhibition galleries various houses of the Viking Period have been reconstructed, among others the Hørning Stave Church. A prehistoric trackway passes reconstructions of an Iron Age house, and graves and cult sites from the Stone Age and Bronze Age.

Selvstændig stiftelse i Stockholm med ansvarsområdet svensk kulturhistorie. I 1873 viste stifteren, Artur Hazelius, i Drottninggatan en udstilling, Skandinavisk-Etnografiska samlingen, som han i 1879 tilbød staten. Da tilbuddet blev afslået, grundlagde han Nordiska museet som det svenske folks ejendom; hans motto for museet var Känn dig själv. I 1882 skænkedes et område, Lejonsletten, på Djurgården til byggeplads for museet, der projekteredes som et firefløjet palads i Christian 4.s renæssancestil, der efter planen skulle rumme de fire nordiske landes folkekulturer; heraf museets navn. Blot én fløj opførtes. I 1891 føjedes hertil det nærliggende frilandsmuseum Skansen (selvstændig institution siden 1963). Til museet hører bl.a. Tyresjö slott, Svindersvik, tekstilmuseet i Högbo (Sandviken) og Julita gård, hvor et omfattende centralmagasin er opført. I tilknytning til museet og Stockholms universitet findes Institut för folklivsforskning, hvor Sigurd Erixon i 1934 tiltrådte som den første indehaver af professoratet.

Munksgaard Boghandel og Forlag er et forlag der blev oprettet i 1917 af Ejnar Munksgaard og Otto Levin under navnet Levin & Munksgaards internationale Boghandel og Forlag på Åboulevarden i København. I 1933 døde Levin, og Munksgaard drev forlaget videre; fra 1938 under navnet Ejnar Munksgaards Forlag. Munksgaard opbyggede dels en stor studenterboghandel med antikvariat, dels et videnskabeligt forlag, der fik verdensry.

Munksgaard's Publishing and Bookstore is a publishing company established in 1917 by Ejnar Munksgaard and Otto Levin under the name Levin & Munksgaards internationale Boghandel og Forlag. After Levin's death in 1933 Munksgaard continued publishing, from 1938 under the name Ejnar Munksgaards Forlag. Munksgaard created a great enterprise with an Academic Bookstore and Antique Bookstore, as well as scholarly publishing house.
Vangsgaards Antikvariat er grundlagt i 2001 af Søren Vangsgaard.
"Vangsgaards Antikvariat" was established in 2001 by Søren Vangsgaard.

orgName.orgName: Hið íslenska bókasafns- og lestrarfélag Suðurlands
The National and University Library of Iceland
The Provincial Archives of Northern Jutland
Stofnun Árna Magnússonar í íslenskum fræðum
The Árni Magnússon Institute for Icelandic Studies
National and University Library of Iceland

org.desc: Danmarks største forsknings- og uddannelsesinstitution.
The largest institution of research and education in Denmark.

orgName.orgName: Institut for Nordisk Sprog og Litteratur
Institut for Nordiske Studier og Sprogvidenskab
Department of Nordic Studies and Linguistics

org.desc: Afdeling for Navneforskning har til opgave 1) at udgive og udforske danske sted- og personnavne 2) at svare på spørgsmål som vedrører danske sted- og personnavne 3) at undervise i sted- og personnavneforskning

The Name Research Section has as its purpose 1) publishing and conducting research into Danish place-names and personal names 2) answering questions about Danish place-names and personal names 3) teaching place-names and personal names
Sveriges ældste forskningsbibliotek
Sweden's oldest research library

orgName.orgName: The National Archival Services of Norway

org.desc: The Vetus Latina Institute was founded in Beuron in 1945 by the Benedictine monk Dom Bonifatius Fischer OSB (✝ 1997). Its goal is the complete collection and critical edition of all surviving remnants of the Old Latin translations of the Bible from manuscripts and citations in ancient writers. Following Dr Fischer, Professor Hermann Josef Frede (✝ 1998) was appointed as the second director of the Institute in 1973. Since 1998, the Institute has been under the direction of Monsignor Roger Gryson, Professor Emeritus at the Catholic University of Louvain-la-Neuve.

orgName.orgName: The Royal Society for Nordic Antiquaries

org.desc: Det Kongelige Nordiske Oldskriftselskab er et af Europas ældste, endnu fungerende, antikvariske selskaber. Selskabet blev grundlagt i 1825 under navnet Det Nordiske Oldskriftselskab af en kreds af mennesker med interesse for Nordens fortid - i særdeleshed dengang de islandske sagaer, kaldet oldskrifter. Blandt stifterne var Rasmus Rask og Carl Christian Rafn
Founded in the 1680s; the philosopher David Hume was once its librarian.

Established by act of Parliament in 1753, the museum was originally based on three collections: those of Sir Hans Sloane; Robert Harley, 1st earl of Oxford; and Sir Robert Cotton. The collections were opened to the public in 1759. In 1973 the British Museum's library was joined by an act of Parliament with a number of other holdings to create the British Library. About half the national library's holdings were kept at the museum until a new library building was opened at St. Pancras in 1997.
Et af verdens største museer og Storbritanniens kulturhistoriske hovedmuseum; indtil 1997 rummede det tillige det britiske nationalbibliotek for humaniora og socialvidenskaberne.

National library of United Kingdom, formed by the British Library Act (1972) and organized by 1 July 1973. For much of the 20th century its holdings were divided among the British Museum library (with some 12 million volumes) and several other buildings, but in 1997-98 a new complex was opened in London, England, near St. Pancras Station in order to unify its vast collections. The British Library holds more than 25 million printed books as well as hundreds of thousands of periodicals, microfilms, rare manuscripts, and titles in electronic form. Its special offerings include the Oriental and India Office Collections (transferred from the Foreign and Commonwealth Office in 1982), the National Sound Archive (formerly the British Institute of Recorded Sound, incorporated into the library in 1983), printed music, a map library, and philatelic materials.

Library of the University of Oxford and one of the oldest and most important nonlending reference libraries in Great Britain. A legal deposit library entitled to free copies of all books printed in Great Britain, the Bodleian is particularly rich in Oriental manuscripts and collections of English literature, local history, and early printing.
The oldest university in the English-speaking world.

Dansk Folkemindesamling er Danmarks arkiv for folkeminder. Folkemindesamlingen bevarer almindelige menneskers livsopfattelser, erindringer, traditioner, sang, musik og dagligdags historier for eftertiden. Dansk Folkemindesamling forsker i alle befolkningsgruppers kultur, og arkivet gemmer på flere hundrede års dokumentation af de mennesker og det samfund, der er baggrunden for Danmark i dag. Pr 1 Juni 2008 er Dansk Folkemindesamling fusioneret med Det Kongelige Bibliotek som en del af Nationalbiblioteket.
Rentukammer var stjórnardeild í danska einveldinu, sem lét sig efnahagsmál varða.
